sourceMeaningMnemonic: Inside your <radical>eye</radical> <radical>stand</radical>s a tiny <radical>village</radical> that makes up your <kanji>pupil</kanji>. That's the black part of your eye!
meaningInfo: Oh, did you think your pupil was a hole? No, no, you misunderstand. That's where the village stands. It's full of little people who whisper to your brain what you should see.
readingMnemonic: All of the people in your <kanji>pupil</kanji> eat <reading>dou</reading>ghnuts (<ja>どう</ja>) all day long. That's why your eye is shaped like a doughnut, with the "hole" (village) as their home.
readingInfo: Even if you're a pupil non-believer, at least you can see how it's shaped like a doughnut hole, right?
